title: Developers get MS Build useful and up-to-date documentation
body:
The aim of the issue is to improve documentation on MSBuild for various groups of users:
- entry-level users
- advanced users
- 3rd party developers (custom task implementation, etc)
- developers of MSBuild

Some of ideas are below:
- create landing page for MSBuild with links to existing materials, likely grouped by topic and advance level
- review existing materials and identify gaps
- review existing tutorials and identify gaps 
- do a user study, as example
   - find some volunteers, not knowledgeable in MSBuild but keen to learn
   - give an advance task to accomplish
   - assess the progress in 1-2 days, interview for what's good/what's not, to identify the gaps
- consider creating blog posts / podcasts about MSBuild

For next release, the effort should be likely time boxed.

Tasks:
- [ ] https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/7163
- [ ] https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/8748
- [ ] https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/9312

nodes.body: We should coordinate with @ghogen about any doc efforts.

We would like to hear from you :loudspeaker: 

Please let us know which resources are useful from you, which resources can be improved and how and what additional resources you'd like to see.
Does not meet the 8.0 adjustment cutline and is not very well developed as a user story overall. Please reopen once direct goals for it are identified.
